title: SCRUM'S THE WORD: Ken Owens' wife to the rescue as Wales hooker avoids suspension
text:
Ken Owens might have avoided a suspension thanks to his wife, joked Warren Gatland.

The Wales hooker was yellow-carded for a tip-tackle of Fiji No 8 Viliame Mata, but was not cited.

Owens’ wife follows the Wales team in a professional capacity, filming for the WRU and Welsh language channel S4C, and was in the press conference room when Gatland was asked if he was worried about a ban for her husband.

He pulled Carys Owens’ leg by saying: ‘No. His wife made sure of it!’

Ken Owen may have avoided a suspension after a bad tackle against Fiji in Pool D

There will be a Samoan reunion across the field when Ireland face the islanders on Saturday.

Irish centre Bundee Aki — who is of Samoan descent and took opponents such as Tim Nanai-Williams out for a BBQ dinner this week — will be greeted in the traditional way.

Samoa captain Jack Lam said: ‘We have no special presents for him, he’ll get the same treatment as everyone else.’

Irish centre Bundee Aki is good friends with members of the Samoan rugby team

Ireland are concerned about the patchy pitch in Fukuoka for the Samoa game, thinking it might cut up badly in the scrums. Wing Keith Earls said: ‘It doesn’t look great, to be honest, but actually out there it’s flat and firm and it doesn’t feel too bad to run on. It’s going to be the same for both teams.’

Ben Tameifuna may weigh 24 stone but he’s an incredible goal-kicker! Tonga have been sharing videos of their prop nailing conversions in training — one is from the touch-line level with the posts!
